alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Dickinson; Douglas; Franklin; Geary; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 3:37AM CST until January 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow, sleet, and light freezing rain expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and light ice accumulations of a few hundredths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Very cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero expected Saturday through Sunday morning. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central and northeast Kansas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills Saturday through Sunday morning could be dangerous for vulnerable populations and those that may become stranded in their vehicles.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
